sen.j: 伏見宮貞教親王（ふしみのみや さだのりしんのう、天保7年9月17日 (旧暦)（1836年10月26日） - 文久2年10月25日 (旧暦)（1862年12月16日））は、江戸時代末期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori (October 26, 1836 - December 16, 1862) was a member of the Imperial Family in the late Edo Period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori (October 26, 1836 - December 16, 1862) was a member of the Imperial Family during the late Edo Period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori (October 26, 1836 - December 16, 1862) was a member of the Imperial family during the late Edo Period.
The twenty-first generation of Fushiminomiya family.
The twenty-first generation of the Fushiminomiya family.
The twenty-first generation of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮邦家親王の第6王子。
sen.e: The sixth prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
The sixth prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
The sixth prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.

sen.j: 母は鷹司政熙の女鷹司景子。
sen.e: His mother was Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
His mother was Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, the daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
His mother was Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, the daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 幼称は、睦宮（よりのみや）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Yorinomiya.
His childhood name was Yorinomiya.
His childhood name was Yorinomiya.

sen.j: 天保13年（1842年）父宮邦家親王の隠居に伴い、7歳で伏見宮家を継承する。
sen.e: Upon retirement of his father Imperial Prince Kuniie in 1842, he inherited Fushiminomiya family at the age of seven.
Upon retirement of his father Imperial Prince Kuniie in 1842, he inherited the Fushiminomiya family at the age of seven.
Upon retirement of his father Imperial Prince Kuniie in 1842, he inherited the Fushiminomiya family at the age of seven.

sen.j: 弘化4年（1847年）仁孝天皇の猶子となり、翌嘉永元年（1848年）3月親王宣下を蒙り、貞教と命名される。
sen.e: He was adopted by Emperor Ninko in 1847, and given the title of Imperial Prince in March 1848 to be named Sadanori.
He was adopted by Emperor Ninko in 1847, and given the title of Imperial Prince in March 1848 and named Sadanori.
He was adopted by Emperor Ninko in 1847, and given the title of Imperial Prince in March 1848 and named Sadanori.

sen.j: 元服し、兵部省卿に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He celebrated his attainment of manhood to be appointed to Hyobushokyo (minister of ministry of military).
He celebrated his attainment of manhood to be appointed to Hyobushokyo (minister of ministry of military).
He celebrated his attainment of manhood to be appointed to Hyobushokyo (minister of ministry of military).

sen.j: 同年5月三品に叙せられ、文久2年（1862年）10月19日二品に叙せられるが、同月25日（実際には14日）薨去。
sen.e: He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' ranks) in May of the same year and to Nihon (the second rank of the same) on October 19, 1862, but he passed away on the twenty-fifth (actually the fourteenth) of the same month.

He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' ranks) in May of the same year and to Nihon (the second rank of the same) on October 19, 1862, but he passed away on the twenty-fifth (actually the fourteenth) of the same month.

He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' ranks) in May of the same year and to Nihon (the second rank of the same) on December 10, 1862, but he passed away on 16 (in fact on 5) of the same month.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.e: He was 27 years old.
He was 27 years old.
He was 27 years old.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Shinjissouin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Shinjissouin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Shinjissouin.
